text: when I was a kid I used to love to eat
these oatmeal cookies it had cream in
the middle as an after-school snack and
I feel like I spent most of my adult
life trying to just recapture those same
flavors and it's January so I'm gonna
bake up another batch and try again
so I know that there's oatmeal in the
cookies and there was always this rich
flavor I think it was brown sugar so I
like to do brown sugar and then just to
give it a little bit more crunch I use
coconut as well and for softness chopped
up dates otherwise making these pretty
much like making any kind of oatmeal
cookie you want to cream your butter
always want to have your butter at room
temperature I like to let it cream for a
few minutes before I add the sugar the
dark brown sugar makes these taste like
butterscotch although you could use
light brown sugar but then you wouldn't
get that deep molasses thing I love it
just a little bit of honey keeps these
really soft keys or not your crisp
kind of oatmeal cookies either your
chewy soft these vanilla extract because
you have to have it
I feel like cookies wouldn't taste like
cookies without vanilla extract you can
add your eggs Adam one at a time
nice one-handed I think cookies
themselves are seasonless with baking
cookies is something you always want to
do in the winter it's just so cozy and
now I've got my dry ingredients it's
always a good idea to mix them together
first before you add them to the mixer
regular old flour a little bit of salt
baking powder and cinnamon so the
problem with dumping all your flour in
is it could make a mess except I'm gonna
do the towel trick if it gets everywhere
on the towel and now I've got oatmeal
this coconut you can see it's a little
bit Brown I toasted it in the oven for a
few minutes and that just brings out the
nutty flavor of coconut and then these
are my chopped up dates so if you don't
like dates and you'd rather use raisins
you could substitute it in you'd have a
more standard type cookie you know
oatmeal raisin but the reasons are chewy
and the dates are just soft spoon and
then we'll roll it into a little ball
over here I've got a bowl full of
cinnamon sugar it makes the cookies kind
of Sparkle which is really nice give
yourself some room in between they're
gonna flatten and spread and you don't
want them to run into each other
what you're looking for here is that
they're no longer shiny and they're a
little bit golden brown around the edges
I'm just gonna let them cool
well the cookies are cooling I mixed
together the filling now the cookies
that I'm thinking of for my childhood
were probably filled with lard
you know whipped with a little bit of
sugar and really want to go there so
instead I made a mixture of cream cheese
and I lightened it with a little
marscapone mascarpone and then I added
some vanilla and a little confectioner
sugar and I'm just gonna make sandwiches
if you have an uneven number of cookies
and obviously you just spread the
filling on one side and eat it write
that in there oh they look just like I
remember except that I'm a grown-up now
which means I can eat the whole plate
and I will maybe not cold plate but
